reviewText: The DVD came as PAL format....hard to watch in the US/Canada since we use NTSC format! Returned the DVD before opening the package.
I received a PAL version. I can not watch it on my NTSC Blu Ray
Great glimpse inside this historic race!
Nice movie seen on NetFlix.. will enjoy.

Disappointed.  The DVD is 83 minutes long with only about 15-20 minutes worth of good video and information.  The rest is filler, put together in a hodge-podge fashion.  Minimal history about the race, very little racing footage (past or present), too many people standing in front of a camera and rambling on and on.  A whole lot of talking but very little actually being said, and too many shots of irrelevant scenes.  Its obvious the producer did not have a clear idea of what he wanted to record.  I ended up "fast forwarding" a significant portion of the DVD.  I have seen better TT documentaries for free on YouTube.
great movie for the man cave
Good video. We're going to stop off for one day on a trip to northern Ireland and Scotland.
Very good film, covers many points not shown on other films.
Love the behind the scene stories!

I'm an avid motorcycle rider/restorer and have watched several TT races.  I was hoping the DVD would contain more of the historical racing at the Isle but there was actually very little coverage at that level.  Most of the coverage however was on the 2003 races (if I remember correctly) but it was well done.  I also would like to have seen more coverage on the different classes, like classes below the 600cc classs as I believe there are antique races and 125cc races and probably others. There was some sidecare coverage however. Most coverage was on the 600cc and the Senior TT (open class).

I would however purchase the DVD again as it's worth seeing and adding to one's motorcyle video collection.
